intro: Calycogonium productum, commonly known as the horned spider plant, is a unique member of the Araceae family. It is characterized by its striking, spiky inflorescence that resembles a cluster of horns, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, white flowers that are encased in a modified leaf called a spathe. Its native habitat includes parts of Central and South America, where it thrives in warm, humid environments. Calycogonium productum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unusual appearance.
